Hi ksnavinkumar 

Thank you for your support of the All-In-One Code Framework effort. 

Here are our findings after discussing with the Silverlight experts. Could you please let me know if the information is useful, and we can further discuss if a code sample is necessary to be created in All-In-One Code Framework.

1. Active Directory login. 
As these answered forum thread discuss (http://forums.silverlight.net/forums/p/101803/232304.aspx, http://forums.silverlight.net/forums/p/54590/144184.aspx), there is no support for Active Directory. The workaround is to interact with active directory through a proxy WCF service which can handle direct calls to the AD services.

2. offline browsing in Silverlight 4.
Could you please clarify "offline browsing"? Do you mean offline browsing *webpage* in Silverlight 4?

3. check for available network connection. (i.e., check weather the server is alive or not) 
To check if network connectivity is available, you can call the NetworkInterface.GetIsNetworkAvailable method.
To check if a certain HTTP web server is available, you may consider sending an HTTP Web Request to the server, and check the response. 
There is a code example in the MSDN page: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.httpwebrequest(v=vs.95).aspx#Y2539  
(see the Examples section)
